text: I feel like Capcom should simply continue the NES-style games they gave us with 9 and 10 and release 11. At least we'll get Mega Man Collection 2 which will have 7 to 10 but still, it can't just be over for the blue bomber. Capcom really has been badly managing their great franchises.

text: heh

text: My favorite track of the game! Nice Supradarky!
author: El Jugador Escaldenc

text: IDK I still prefer 2 and 3 but I think 9 is right there. I could see an argument for it being the best. It has a lot of amazing music.
author: Wild West

text: The fact that they made classic NES-style Mega Man games in the late 2000s makes me incredible happy. I haven't been able to play 9 or 10 (or even 7 or 8 for that matter), but I am loving the music of these. Music composers can really weave magic with the restrictions of 8-bit sounds.
author: That Gaming Author

text:
I'm glad we're getting a second collection. The save stats gave me the opportunity to finally finish all 6 games :D 
I can't wait to finally kill splash woman!! Been stuck for years -_-

text: Not a chance that Capcom makes any new Mega Man. While Inafune's influence on the series is overstated, he is the spiritual leader of the franchise, and he got blackballed by the company he worked for for over 20 years.

text: Yeah, I get it. You'd hate Dr. Wily then. The fight is initially very hard but once you figure out how to deal with it in the most efficient way, you can pretty much breeze through it.
